title: Game Bug Involving Video Card
body: There is a error popping up stating there is a DirectX error and League of Legends can't start. "Make sure your video card drivers are updated to the manufacturers current drivers.", Is the error I am getting. Is anyone else getting this error? Also, why are summoners being punished for issues that are not a direct cause of any conduct that is a violation of the summoners code? Why can Riot not review the logs and bug reports to overturn any penalties enforced on a summoner?

replies.body:
It sounds like you might have run into the issue we recently made a [**sticky**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/nxyEq9WA-532017-14-screen-directx-error-issues) about. Rest easy knowing that we can see if that issue ended up giving you any unneeded penalties and are willing to help with that as well if possible. In the meantime, I'd strongly suggest trying to delete your game configuration files, as that seems to have been helping for most people!

- Log into the game client
- Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
- Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
- Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly. 
- Leave game to sync settings

Hit me back and let me know if that helped!

Broporo,

   This actually did work for me. I apologize for the late response. I am on the game everyday now but I was thrown into a lower queue for 5 matches due to being afk for games.
this did not work for me.
